{{also|Holen|holeň}} ==English== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|en|/ˈhəʊlən/}} ===Verb=== {{head|en|verb form}} # {{past participle of|en|hele|nocat=1}} ---- ==Breton== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|br|cel-pro|*[[salanos]], *[[salenos]]}} (compare {{cog|cy|halen}} and {{cog|ga|salann}}), from {{inh|br|ine-pro|*séh₂ls}}, whence also {{cog|en|salt}} and {{cog|la|sāl}}. ===Pronunciation=== {{rfp|br}} ===Noun=== {{br-noun|m}} # [[salt]] ---- ==Dutch== ===Pronunciation=== * {{audio|nl|Nl-holen.ogg|Audio}} ===Noun=== {{head|nl|noun plural form}} # {{nl-noun form of|pl|hol}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|holen}}, {{m|gmh|holn}}, from {{inh|de|goh|holōn}}, {{m|goh|holēn||to fetch, get, draw}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*hulōną}}, {{m|gem-pro|*hulēną||to summon, call, fetch}}. More at {{l|en|haul}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈhoːlən/|[ˈhoːlən]|[ˈhoːl̩n]}} * {{audio|de|De-holen.ogg|Audio}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-weak|holt|holte|geholt}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to ([[go]]) [[get]], to [[fetch]] {{gloss|to go somewhere and take something}} #: {{ux|de|'''Hol''' noch einen Stuhl!|'''Go get''' another chair!}} # {{lb|de|transitive|always with reflexive dative|colloquial}} to [[get]] {{gloss|to acquire, buy}} #: {{ux|de|Ich '''hol''' mir morgen ’n neuen Fernseher.|I’m '''getting''' a new TV tomorrow.}} ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-weak|hol|geholt|h}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|abholen}} * {{l|de|ausholen}} * {{l|de|einholen}} * {{l|de|erholen}} * {{l|de|herbeiholen}} * {{l|de|runterholen}} * {{l|de|wiederholen}} * {{l|de|überholen}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Low German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|nds|osx|haldan}}. ===Verb=== {{head|nds|verb|past singular|heel|past participle|holen|auxiliary verb|hebben}} # to [[hold]] ====Conjugation==== {{nds-conj-st|class=7|hool|höll|heel|hel|hol}} ---- ==Norwegian Bokmål== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|nb|hola}} ===Noun=== {{head|nb|noun form|g=m|g2=f}} # {{inflection of|nb|hole||def|m|s}} ---- ==Old English== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|ang|holeġn|holiġn|holiġ}} ===Etymology=== From {{der|ang|gem-pro|*hulisaz}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|ang|/ˈholen/}} ===Noun=== {{ang-noun|m|head=holen|holnas}} # {{lb|ang|botany}} [[holly]] ====Inflection==== {{ang-decl-noun-a-m|holn|nomsg=holen}} ====Alternative forms==== * {{l|ang|holeġn}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|enm|holyn}}, {{l|enm|holin}}, {{l|enm|holy}}, {{l|enm|holly}} ** {{desc|en|holly}}, {{l|en|hollen}} ** {{desc|sco|holin}}, {{l|sco|hollin}}, {{l|sco|holyn}} * {{desc|enm|holme}}, {{l|enm|holm}} ** {{desc|en|holm}} ---- ==Tagalog== ===Noun=== # [[marble]] (small spherical ball of rock, glass, ceramic or metal used in games and races).
